Yes, of course.

The crux, of course, is t=
hat any transaction could potentially trigger
a round of content negotiatio=
n. But also, many systems tend to be more
liberal with what they return tha=
n what they accept.

Easy to see a system the returns both text/html as wel=
l as an
application specific XML format for a GET (simple filter can simply=

send the XML in an HTML escaped format as a result, for example), but
will=
 out right refuse a text/html type on a POST/PUT.
